summary.para: The Koreographer is the object responsible for triggering events. It takes the current music point, querries the Koreography for events at those times, and then sends cues to "actors" that are listening for directions.

This setup *does not* stop an "actor" from looking directly at a specific Koreography Track. This is fully supported. It just means that that actor will only get cues for the Tracks for which it has registered.
The music is "reported" to the Koreographer. In this sense, the Koreographer "Hears" the music.
The Koreographer manages a list of Koreography. These are considered "loaded" and any time the associated music is played, their events are triggered.

When Koreography is loaded, the Koreographer finds-or-adds a string->EventObj mapping to a managed list. This allows the Koreographer to get notified when Koreography Events occur directly from the triggered tracks. The events are then automatically forwarded to those who registered for such events with the Koreographer.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase
member.summary: The base class for all Koreography Track classes. This allows more flexibility for the user. Each Koreography Track is a single list of Koreography Events. This class attempts to guarantee that all events in the track are stored in order by Start Sample position.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase.GetEventsInRangeTracked(System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Returns a list of events in the provided range. This includes events that intersect the range and is inclusive of Start/End positions!

This method is now a wrapper. Please use the other version of GetEventsInRangeTracked directly. This will be removed in a future update. It should be noted that use of this method may result in sub-optimal performance for complex situations.

member.returns: The events defined within the given range.
member.param: First sample of the range to search.
Last sample of the range to search.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase.GetEventsInRangeTracked(System.Int32,System.Int32,SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase.TrackingCrumbs@,System.Collections.Generic.List{SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyEvent})

summary.para: Adds any events found within the provided range to the specified list. This includes events that intersect the range and is inclusive of Start/End positions! The list is NOT cleared prior to adding events.

Please note that the TrackingCrumbs parameter is a struct. Proper use of this method involves sending the SAME struct each time. The contents of the struct are modified internally in preparation for the next range check. This is the Tracking portion of the method. If you only need a specific set of events and do not need to track subsequent checks, please use GetEventsInRange instead.

member.param: First sample of the range to search.
Last sample of the range to search.
The tracking information about where to begin looking.
The List into which to add KoreographyEvents.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase.GetAllEvents
member.summary: Get a List of all Koreography Events in this Koreography Track.
member.returns: Returns a new List with all Koreography Events in the track. Operations on this list do not affect the internally maintained list.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyTrackBase.CheckForEvents(System.Int32,System.Int32,SonicBloom.Koreo.DeltaSlice)

summary.para: Checks for Koreography Events within the current time range. If events are found, they are triggered.

Note that this startTime should NOT be the same as the previous call's endTime as the check is inclusive of both startTime and endTime. This means that if a OneOff were to fall on a boundary and this frame's endTime became next frame's startTime, that event would be triggered twice.

member.param: Start time of the range in samples.
End time of the range in samples.
The timing information to be passed to any triggered callbacks.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.SpectrumPayloadEventExtensions.GetSpectrumAtTime(SonicBloom.Koreo.KoreographyEvent,System.Int32,System.Single[]@,System.Int32)

summary.para: Fills the passed in array with spectrum values. The returned values are interpolated between recorded spectrum entries. If the array is null or not the correct length, it will be overwritten with a newly created array of the correct length. The array is not touched if the payload is not a .

If is greater than zero, the number of bins return will be clamped and the values averaged. The averaging is equal: each bin will only affect a single returned bin. When this clamping occurs, the number of bins in the spectrum after the process completes will likely be less than .

member.param: The 'this' KoreographyEvent for the extension method.
The specified sample time.
An array of float values into which spectrum data will be added.
The maximum number of bins to fit data into. If this number is lower than the number of bins available, bin-averaging will occur.

summary.para: Fills the passed in array with spectrum values. The returned values are interpolated between spectrum entries based on . If the array is null or not the correct length, it will be overwritten with a newly created array of the correct length.

If is greater than zero, the number of bins return will be clamped and the values averaged. The averaging is equal: each bin will only affect a single returned bin. When this clamping occurs, the number of bins in the spectrum after the process completes will likely be less than .

member.param: An array of float values into which spectrum data will be added.
The time at which to look up in the range [0,1].

summary.para: Fills the passed in array with spectrum values. The returned values are interpolated between spectrum entries based on the time. If the array is null or not the correct length, it will be overwritten with a newly created array of the correct length.

If is greater than zero, the number of bins return will be clamped and the values averaged. The averaging is equal: each bin will only affect a single returned bin. When this clamping occurs, the number of bins in the spectrum after the process completes will likely be less than .

member.param: An array of float values into which spectrum data will be added.
The sample position to check.
The maximum number of bins to fit data into. If this number is lower than the number of bins available, bin-averaging will occur.

summary.para: The will attempt to play multiple synchronized layers of audio. These layers can be configured using raw AudioClip references or with Koreography references. The interface disallows setting both for a single layer.

Under certain conditions, the layers may not all start at the same time. This is usually due to heavy CPU load. Use the SyncPlayDelay feature to schedule the playback of audio in a synchronized fashion.

Internally, each layer requires an AudioSource component for playback of the AudioClip. It is possible to specify a specific AudioSource component for a layer to use. If no AudioSource is specified, the system will add one to use automatically.

member.summary: The SimpleMusicPlayer component plays audio using Koreography. Instead of taking an AudioClip reference, it takes a single Koreography reference. At runtime, the Koreography is loaded into the static Koreographer Instance. Adding this component will also add an AudioSource component, which is used internally to control audio. The SimpleMusicPlayer uses the AudioClip reference in the referenced Koreography for audio playback.

summary.para: Schedule's the provided Audio to be started at the sample location in the currently playing track indicated in the curSongSampleTransLoc parameter.
If no song is currently playing, the playback occurs immediately.
If the currently playing song has already played (or been read) beyond the transition point, this returns false.

member.returns: true, if audio was scheduled, false otherwise.
member.param: The audio group to schedule.
The sample location in the currently playing song to transition at. A value of 0 means "when the current song ends".
The start sample offset for the scheduled audio group.
The sample length of the audio to playback. A value of 0 means "until the end".
If set to true any previously queued song will be overwritten.

summary.para: This class is a data supplier: it logically combines Koreography with an AudioClip for playback purposes.

Note that EITHER the Koreography or the clip is sufficient to work. This is designed to allow non-choreographed layers in the audio system. In the case that both exist, the AudioClip specified by the user is preferred. WARNING: this will cause issues with the specified Koreography if the clip is different.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.EventIDAttribute
member.summary: The EventID Attribute allows you to mark a serializable or public string field as being an EventID. When this happens, the field gets special consideration in the Inspector, showing a customizable field and a list of Event ID options configured across Koreography Tracks found within the current project.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.NoEditorCreateAttribute
member.summary: The NoEditorCreate Attribute allows you to mark a class such that it cannot be created using the standard tools in the Koreography Editor. Currently works for Payloads and KoreographyTracks.

member.summary: The Audio Source Visor adds Koreographer event triggering support to a single, targeted AudioSource. Any audio played back through the AudioSource will be reported to either the default Koreographer or the , if specified.

member.value: The DSP time at which audio playback is set to begin.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioSourceVisor.ResyncTimings(System.Int32)

summary.para: This method should be called when the AudioSource being watched is seeked to ensure proper timing updates. Specify the seek position in samples with the parameter.
This should also be used if the AudioClip loaded into the AudioSource changes.

member.param: The sample position to which the AudioSource was seeked. The value will be internally clamped between [0, totalSamplesInClip - 1).

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor
member.summary: The AudioVisor is built on top of VisorBase, specifically adding support for Unity's built-in audio system. It is built around the AudioSource component and sends timing information based on its intricacies.

member.summary: The total number of DSP buffers read for this frame.

member.summary: The raw sample time as reported by the AudioSource this frame.

member.summary: The pitch as reported by the AudioSource this frame.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.S_EstimationWindowBufferCount
member.summary: The number of buffers' worth of samples to which to restrict estimations. This helps define how "sloppy" the estimations can be relative to the [likely] actual playhead location.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.S_FuzzFactor
member.summary: The number of buffers' worth of "fuzziness" to add to the seek check window (both ends) and to the estimation window (both ends). As the estimation system works by counting the number of audio buffers being fed, it is possible (especially in scenarios with extremely high frame rate) that the audio thread is "sampled" after a buffer (or configured number of buffers) has been _read_ but _before_ that buffer (those buffers) could be _refilled_. This "fuzz-factor" gives a small amount of buffer-relative leeway to the estimation system, taking a bit of pressure off of the expected audio thread update frequency.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.S_OverEstimationPercent
member.summary: How much to allow the timing system to "overestimate" the timing position. Setting this to 0 will cause it to never estimate beyond the reported values. Setting this to 1 will cause it to estimate to a maximum of [the estimation window's buffer length] beyond the reported audio time value. Setting it to 0.5 will keep things balanced. Set this value to 0 to avoid estimating into positions that never actually happen due to seeking.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.audioCom
member.summary: The AudioSource component that this AudioVisor watches over.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.clipID
member.summary: The ID of the AudioClip this AudioVisor is watching over. If a change is detected, this should get updated.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.dspPlayStartTime
member.summary: If AudioSource Scheduling features are used, this field will contain the target start time according to the DSP clock.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.estimatedSamplePosition
member.summary: The sample position of the AudioSource, estimated using Time.unscaledDeltaTime. This value is clamped to within one half audio buffer's distance from the value reported by the AudioSource itself.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.expectedSamplePosition
member.summary: The expected sample position of the AudioSource, calculated each frame based on the progress of the Audio DSP clock. This value is updated to be the same as that reported by the AudioSource itself unless there is no update to the AudioSource between frames.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.lastFrameStats
member.summary: Timing and AudioSource state information useful for time estimation.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.bDidLoop
member.summary: Whether or not the AudioSource looped this frame.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.dspBufferSize
member.summary: The audio system's current buffer size. This is used for estimation.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.dspBufferCount
member.summary: The audio system's current buffer count. This is used for estimation.

member.name: F:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.outputSampleRate
member.summary: The audio system's current output sample rate. This should almost never change.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.EstimationWindowBufferCount
member.summary: [ADVANCED] Gets or sets the number of audio buffers to use when calculating the overall size of the Estimation Window. This determines how "tightly" the estimation system should "track" the audio position updates. Valid values are between 1 and twice the number of buffers that make up the Audio (DSP) Ring Buffer.
member.value: The number of DSP buffers to use when calculating the Estimation Window size.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.FuzzFactor
member.summary: [ADVANCED] Gets or sets the amount of "fuzziness" to open up the Estimation system's internal "Seek Check" and "Estimation" windows. This value affects both the top and bottom ends of the Seek Check Window, but only the top end of the Estimation Window. Valid values are between 0 and 1.
member.value: The "fuzziness" of the estimation system in terms of the size of a single DSP buffer.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.OverEstimationPercent
member.summary: [ADVANCED] Gets or sets the percent of the Estimation Window to allow as an "over-estimation" from the audio position reported by the audio engine. A value of 0 will cause the Estimation Window to disallow over-estimation. A value of 1 will cause the Estimation Window to be 100% over-estimation. It is preferable to have as little over-estimation as possible.
member.value: The percent of the Estimation Window to alot to over- estimation.

member.name: P:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.ScheduledPlayTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the scheduled play time of the associated AudioSource. This is required for properly handling scheduled playback because Unity does not have a way to inspect the scheduled state of an AudioClip in an AudioSource.
member.value: The DSP time at which audio playback is set to begin.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.ResyncTimings
member.summary: This is used when the AudioSource has a clip change or a jump within the audio. The AudioVisor attempts to catch "seeks" automatically, but can't guarantee perfect timing. This forces the AudioVisor to resync to the sample time reported by the AudioSource at time of call. Using this is far better than allowing the AudioVisor to estimate the seeked position.

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.AudioVisor.ResyncTimings(System.Int32)
member.summary: This is used when the AudioSource has a clip change or a jump within the audio. The AudioVisor attempts to catch "seeks" automatically, but can't guarantee perfect timing. This forces the AudioVisor to resync to the sample position supplied in the parameter. Using this is far better than allowing the AudioVisor to estimate the seeked position.
member.param: The sample position to which the AudioSource was seeked.

member.name: T:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.VisorBase
member.summary: The Visor is the glue that binds the Audio Player and the Koreographer component together. The Visor's sole responsibility is to provide the Koreographer component with information with which it can process Koreography Events. This base class provides a common interface and set of core processing that handles most potential audio update scenarios. Override and fill in the blanks!

member.name: M:SonicBloom.Koreo.Players.VisorBase.Update
member.summary: Looks at the Audio System and determines how far the audio has moved. It then reports those results, if necessary, to the specified Koreographer to trigger any encountered Koreography Events. This implementation is fairly robust in that it recognizes that some audio systems will not report a change in sample position until more samples are requested (no estimation). In such cases it attempts to estimate the time spent.
